alert.note: Alert for Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 10:37AM EDT until October 02 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Florida... North Fork Black Creek At Middleburg affecting Clay County. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Black Creek At Middleburg. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lazy Acre Road begins to flood. Lowlands flood and boat docks are affected. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to move into homes. At 22.0 feet, Significant flooding of homes occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 1.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning to a crest of 20.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
